item.description:
## Overview
The Products resource is the central inventory management component of Invent-MAG, maintaining comprehensive information about all items available for sale or use in the business. This resource powers inventory tracking, sales, purchasing, and reporting across the entire system.

## Purpose
Products represent physical or digital items that the business stocks, sells, or manufactures. This resource maintains detailed product information including specifications, pricing, stock levels, and relationships, enabling effective inventory control and sales operations.

## Key Functionality
- Manage complete product catalog with detailed specifications
- Track inventory levels across multiple warehouses
- Support product variants (size, color, etc.)
- Maintain pricing tiers and customer-specific pricing
- Handle product images and documentation
- Track product costs and profit margins
- Support barcode and SKU management
- Enable product bundling and kits
- Manage product lifecycle (active, discontinued, etc.)
- Support serialized and batch-tracked items

## Common Operations
- **GET /products** - List all products with search, filtering, and pagination
- **GET /products/{id}** - Retrieve detailed product information and stock levels
- **POST /products** - Create new product records
- **PUT/PATCH /products/{id}** - Update product details, pricing, or specifications
- **DELETE /products/{id}** - Remove products (typically restricted to unused items)

## Relationships
- **Categories**: Products are organized into categories
- **Warehouses**: Stock levels maintained per warehouse location
- **Units**: Measurement units for quantity tracking
- **Suppliers**: Supplier associations for purchasing
- **Purchase Order Items**: Products ordered from suppliers
- **Sales Items**: Products sold to customers
- **Sales Order Items**: Products in customer orders
- **POS**: Products sold through point-of-sale
- **Stock Adjustments**: Inventory level changes
- **Taxes**: Tax rates applicable to products
- **Transactions**: Financial impact of inventory movements

## Important Fields
- Product name and description
- SKU (Stock Keeping Unit) and barcode
- Category assignment
- Unit of measure
- Cost price and selling price
- Stock quantity per warehouse
- Reorder level and reorder quantity
- Supplier information
- Product images and attachments
- Product status (active, inactive, discontinued)
- Tax applicability
- Weight and dimensions
- Serial number or batch tracking requirements
- Custom attributes and specifications

## Business Context
Use these endpoints when:
- Setting up initial product catalog
- Adding new inventory items
- Updating product pricing or specifications
- Checking stock availability
- Managing product information for e-commerce
- Generating product catalogs or price lists
- Analyzing inventory turnover
- Planning reorder points and quantities
- Integrating with supplier systems
- Supporting barcode scanning operations
- Managing product lifecycle changes
- Conducting inventory audits

item.name: Purchase Order Items

query.description: The number of items to return per page. Defaults to 15.

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves a paginated list of all purchase order items (line items) in the system. This endpoint returns item-level details from purchase orders including products, quantities, pricing, discounts, and fulfillment status.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/po-items?per_page=25`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
- **per_page** (integer, optional): Number of items to return per page. Default is 25. Controls pagination size for better performance.

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response format
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token for API access

## Request Body
Not applicable for GET requests.

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing:
- **data**: Array of purchase order item objects with the following properties:
  - `id`: Unique identifier for the purchase order item
  - `purchase_order_id`: ID of the parent purchase order
  - `product_id`: ID of the product being ordered
  - `quantity`: Ordered quantity
  - `unit_price`: Price per unit
  - `discount`: Discount amount applied
  - `discount_type`: Type of discount (percentage or fixed)
  - `total`: Total line item amount
  - `received_quantity`: Quantity received so far
  - `remaining_quantity`: Quantity still pending receipt
  - `expiry_date`: Product expiry date (if applicable)
  - `created_at`: Timestamp of item creation
  - `updated_at`: Timestamp of last update
- **meta**: Pagination metadata (total count, current page, per_page, last_page)
- **links**: Navigation links (first, last, prev, next)

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order items retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view purchase order items
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Invalid query parameters
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- View all purchase order line items across the system
- Track items across multiple purchase orders for inventory planning
- Analyze purchasing patterns by product and supplier
- Monitor received vs ordered quantities for fulfillment tracking
- Generate procurement and spending reports
- Reconcile purchase orders with received inventory
- Identify partially fulfilled orders requiring follow-up
- Calculate total pending inventory value

## Notes
- Results are paginated for performance optimization with large datasets
- Each item belongs to a specific purchase order and represents a single product line
- Received quantity tracks fulfillment progress and can be less than or equal to ordered quantity
- Remaining quantity is automatically calculated as (quantity - received_quantity)
- Use this endpoint for detailed purchase order analysis and inventory receiving processes
- Essential for tracking partial shipments and backorders
- Discount types can be percentage-based or fixed amount
- Expiry dates are critical for perishable goods management
- Total amount reflects quantity  unit_price minus any applicable discounts

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Creates a new purchase order item (line item) within an existing purchase order. This endpoint adds a product line to a purchase order with specified quantity, pricing, discount, and expiry information.

## HTTP Method & URL
**POST** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/po-items`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response format
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token for API access

## Request Body
JSON object with the following properties:
- **po_id** (string, required): ID of the parent purchase order to add this item to
- **product_id** (string, required): ID of the product being ordered
- **quantity** (number, required): Quantity to order (must be greater than 0)
- **price** (number, required): Unit price for the product
- **discount** (number, optional): Discount amount to apply (default: 0)
- **discount_type** (string, optional): Type of discount - "percentage" or "fixed" (default: "fixed")
- **total** (number, required): Total line item amount (calculated as: quantity  price - discount)
- **expiry_date** (string, optional): Product expiry date in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss)
- **remaining_quantity** (number, optional): Initial remaining quantity (defaults to ordered quantity if not specified)

Example:
```json
{
  "po_id": "123",
  "product_id": "456",
  "quantity": 100,
  "price": 25.50,
  "discount": 50.00,
  "discount_type": "fixed",
  "total": 2500.00,
  "expiry_date": "2025-12-31T23:59:59",
  "remaining_quantity": 100
}
```

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing:
- **success**: Boolean indicating operation success
- **message**: Success message
- **data**: The newly created purchase order item object with all properties including:
  - `id`: Unique identifier assigned to the new item
  - All submitted fields
  - `received_quantity`: Initially set to 0
  - `created_at`: Timestamp of creation
  - `updated_at`: Timestamp of creation

## Status Codes
- **201 Created** - Purchase order item created successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request data or missing required fields
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to create purchase order items
- **404 Not Found** - Specified purchase order or product does not exist
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (e.g., negative quantity, invalid discount type)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Add a new product line to an existing purchase order
- Create line items when building a purchase order
- Add additional items to a purchase order after initial creation
- Specify product quantities and pricing for procurement
- Apply discounts to specific line items
- Set expiry dates for perishable goods
- Initialize inventory receiving tracking

## Notes
- The purchase order (po_id) must exist before adding items to it
- The product (product_id) must exist in the product catalog
- Total amount should be calculated as: (quantity  price) - discount
- For percentage discounts, calculate: (quantity  price)  (1 - discount/100)
- Remaining quantity tracks unfulfilled items and defaults to the ordered quantity
- Received quantity is automatically initialized to 0
- Expiry date is optional but recommended for perishable products
- Discount type must be either "percentage" or "fixed"
- Quantity and price must be positive numbers
- Once created, the item can be updated or deleted using its assigned ID
- Creating items updates the parent purchase order's total amount

## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves detailed information about a specific purchase order item (line item) by its unique identifier. This endpoint returns complete details including product information, quantities, pricing, discounts, and fulfillment status.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/po-items/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the purchase order item to retrieve

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response format
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token for API access

## Request Body
Not applicable for GET requests.

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing:
- **success**: Boolean indicating operation success
- **data**: Purchase order item object with the following properties:
  - `id`: Unique identifier for the purchase order item
  - `purchase_order_id`: ID of the parent purchase order
  - `product_id`: ID of the product being ordered
  - `quantity`: Ordered quantity
  - `unit_price`: Price per unit
  - `discount`: Discount amount applied
  - `discount_type`: Type of discount (percentage or fixed)
  - `total`: Total line item amount
  - `received_quantity`: Quantity received so far
  - `remaining_quantity`: Quantity still pending receipt
  - `expiry_date`: Product expiry date (if applicable)
  - `created_at`: Timestamp of item creation
  - `updated_at`: Timestamp of last update
  - May include related product and purchase order details

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order item retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view this purchase order item
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order item with specified ID does not exist
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- View detailed information about a specific purchase order line item
- Check fulfillment status of a particular item
- Verify pricing and discount details for an item
- Review product and quantity information before receiving inventory
- Audit purchase order item details for reconciliation
- Track remaining quantity for partial shipments
- Verify expiry dates for perishable goods
- Retrieve item details for updating or modification

## Notes
- The ID must be a valid purchase order item identifier
- Returns complete item details including calculated fields
- Remaining quantity is calculated as (quantity - received_quantity)
- Total amount reflects quantity  unit_price minus applicable discounts
- Use this endpoint to verify item details before performing updates
- Essential for inventory receiving workflows to confirm item details
- Received quantity indicates fulfillment progress
- Expiry date is null for non-perishable products
- Related product and purchase order information may be included in the response
- Useful for generating detailed line item reports and analysis

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Updates an existing purchase order item (line item) with new information. This endpoint allows modification of product quantities, pricing, discounts, expiry dates, and fulfillment status for a specific line item within a purchase order.

## HTTP Method & URL
**PUT** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/po-items/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the purchase order item to update

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response format
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token for API access

## Request Body
JSON object with the following properties (all optional, include only fields to update):
- **po_id** (string, optional): ID of the parent purchase order (rarely changed)
- **product_id** (string, optional): ID of the product (use with caution as it changes the item)
- **quantity** (number, optional): Updated quantity to order (must be greater than 0)
- **price** (number, optional): Updated unit price for the product
- **discount** (number, optional): Updated discount amount to apply
- **discount_type** (string, optional): Type of discount - "percentage" or "fixed"
- **total** (number, optional): Updated total line item amount (recalculated if quantity/price/discount changes)
- **expiry_date** (string, optional): Updated product expiry date in ISO 8601 format
- **remaining_quantity** (number, optional): Updated remaining quantity (typically modified during receiving)

Example:
```json
{
  "quantity": 150,
  "price": 24.00,
  "discount": 100.00,
  "discount_type": "fixed",
  "total": 3500.00,
  "remaining_quantity": 150
}
```

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing:
- **success**: Boolean indicating operation success
- **message**: Success message
- **data**: The updated purchase order item object with all current properties including:
  - All updated fields
  - `updated_at`: Timestamp of the update
  - All other existing fields

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order item updated successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request data
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to update purchase order items
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order item with specified ID does not exist
- **409 Conflict** - Update conflicts with business rules (e.g., reducing quantity below received amount)
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (e.g., negative quantity, invalid discount type)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Adjust ordered quantities based on supplier availability
- Update pricing when supplier changes prices
- Modify discounts negotiated with suppliers
- Update expiry dates for perishable goods
- Record received quantities during inventory receiving
- Correct data entry errors in line items
- Adjust remaining quantity after partial shipments
- Update totals when recalculating order amounts
- Change product substitutions (by updating product_id)

## Notes
- Only include fields that need to be updated in the request body
- Updating quantity or price should trigger total recalculation
- Cannot reduce quantity below already received quantity
- Remaining quantity should not exceed ordered quantity
- Updates to pricing or discounts affect the parent purchase order total
- Received quantity is typically updated through separate receiving endpoints
- Expiry date updates are important for perishable goods tracking
- Changing product_id effectively substitutes one product for another
- Total should be recalculated as: (quantity  price) - discount
- For percentage discounts: (quantity  price)  (1 - discount/100)
- Updates may require approval workflows depending on business rules
- Audit trail should track all modifications for compliance
- Cannot update items in closed or completed purchase orders
- Consider impact on inventory forecasting when changing quantities

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Permanently deletes a specific purchase order item (line item) from the system. This endpoint removes a product line from a purchase order and updates the parent purchase order's total amount accordingly.

## HTTP Method & URL
**DELETE** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/po-items/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the purchase order item to delete

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response format
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token for API access

## Request Body
Not applicable for DELETE requests.

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing:
- **success**: Boolean indicating operation success (true)
- **message**: Confirmation message indicating successful deletion
- **data**: May include the deleted item's ID or null

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order item deleted successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to delete purchase order items
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order item with specified ID does not exist
- **409 Conflict** - Cannot delete item due to business rules (e.g., already received inventory)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Remove an incorrect product line from a purchase order
- Delete duplicate line items
- Remove items from a purchase order before finalization
- Clean up purchase orders during order preparation
- Correct ordering mistakes before submission
- Remove cancelled items from active purchase orders
- Adjust purchase orders based on budget changes

## Notes
- This operation is permanent and cannot be undone
- Deleting an item updates the parent purchase order's total amount
- Items with received inventory may not be deletable depending on business rules
- Consider the impact on purchase order totals before deletion
- Use with caution as this affects procurement records
- May trigger recalculation of purchase order totals and taxes
- Audit logs should track deletion for compliance purposes
- Cannot delete items from closed or completed purchase orders
- Verify item details before deletion to avoid mistakes
- Alternative: Consider updating quantity to 0 instead of deletion for audit trail
- Deletion may affect inventory forecasting and planning reports
- Ensure proper authorization before allowing deletion operations

variable.description: The ID of the po item.

originalRequest.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Permanently deletes a specific purchase order item (line item) from the system. This endpoint removes a product line from a purchase order and updates the parent purchase order's total amount accordingly.

## HTTP Method & URL
**DELETE** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/po-items/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the purchase order item to delete

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response format
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token for API access

## Request Body
Not applicable for DELETE requests.

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing:
- **success**: Boolean indicating operation success (true)
- **message**: Confirmation message indicating successful deletion
- **data**: May include the deleted item's ID or null

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order item deleted successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to delete purchase order items
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order item with specified ID does not exist
- **409 Conflict** - Cannot delete item due to business rules (e.g., already received inventory)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Remove an incorrect product line from a purchase order
- Delete duplicate line items
- Remove items from a purchase order before finalization
- Clean up purchase orders during order preparation
- Correct ordering mistakes before submission
- Remove cancelled items from active purchase orders
- Adjust purchase orders based on budget changes

## Notes
- This operation is permanent and cannot be undone
- Deleting an item updates the parent purchase order's total amount
- Items with received inventory may not be deletable depending on business rules
- Consider the impact on purchase order totals before deletion
- Use with caution as this affects procurement records
- May trigger recalculation of purchase order totals and taxes
- Audit logs should track deletion for compliance purposes
- Cannot delete items from closed or completed purchase orders
- Verify item details before deletion to avoid mistakes
- Alternative: Consider updating quantity to 0 instead of deletion for audit trail
- Deletion may affect inventory forecasting and planning reports
- Ensure proper authorization before allowing deletion operations

item.description:
## Overview
The Purchase Order Items resource manages individual line items within purchase orders in the Invent-MAG system. Each item represents a specific product being ordered from a supplier, including quantity, pricing, and delivery details.

## Purpose
Purchase Order Items provide granular control over procurement transactions, tracking each product ordered with its specific terms, quantities, and costs. This enables detailed purchase analysis, accurate inventory receiving, and precise cost accounting.

## Key Functionality
- Define specific products and quantities in purchase orders
- Track item-level pricing and discounts
- Manage partial deliveries and backorders
- Record received quantities vs. ordered quantities
- Calculate line-level costs and taxes
- Support item-specific delivery dates
- Track item status (pending, partial, received, cancelled)
- Enable item-level notes and specifications

## Common Operations
- **GET /purchase-order-items** - List all purchase order items with filtering
- **GET /purchase-order-items/{id}** - Retrieve specific item details and status
- **POST /purchase-order-items** - Add items to purchase orders
- **PUT/PATCH /purchase-order-items/{id}** - Update quantities, pricing, or status
- **DELETE /purchase-order-items/{id}** - Remove items from purchase orders

## Relationships
- **Purchase Orders**: Items belong to specific purchase orders
- **Products**: Each item references a product being ordered
- **Suppliers**: Items are sourced from specific suppliers
- **Warehouses**: Received items are allocated to warehouses
- **Stock Adjustments**: Receiving items creates stock adjustments
- **Accounts**: Item costs affect inventory and payable accounts
- **Journal Entries**: Receiving generates accounting entries
- **Taxes**: Tax calculations per item

## Important Fields
- Product ID and description
- Ordered quantity and unit of measure
- Unit cost and line total
- Discount amount or percentage
- Tax amount
- Received quantity
- Outstanding quantity
- Expected delivery date
- Item status (pending, partial, received, cancelled)
- Warehouse destination
- Item notes or specifications
- Line number/sequence

## Business Context
Use these endpoints when:
- Creating detailed purchase orders
- Receiving partial shipments
- Tracking backorders and outstanding items
- Reconciling supplier invoices with orders
- Analyzing purchase costs by product
- Managing inventory replenishment
- Updating order quantities before confirmation
- Recording quality issues or returns
- Generating receiving reports
- Calculating landed costs
- Supporting three-way matching (PO, receipt, invoice)

item.name: Purchase Orders

query.description: The number of purchase orders to return per page. Defaults to 15.

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves a paginated list of all purchase orders in the system. This endpoint allows you to view and manage procurement activities, track supplier orders, and monitor purchasing workflows across your organization.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/purchases?per_page=25`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
- **per_page** (integer, optional): Number of purchase orders to return per page (default: 25, max: 100)
- **page** (integer, optional): Page number for pagination (default: 1)
- **status** (string, optional): Filter by order status (Pending, Approved, Received, Paid, Cancelled)
- **supplier_id** (integer, optional): Filter by supplier ID
- **order_date_from** (date, optional): Filter orders from this date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- **order_date_to** (date, optional): Filter orders to this date (YYYY-MM-DD)

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
Not applicable for GET requests.

## Response Format
Returns a paginated JSON object containing an array of purchase orders with the following structure:
- **data**: Array of purchase order objects
- **current_page**: Current page number
- **per_page**: Items per page
- **total**: Total number of purchase orders
- **last_page**: Last page number

Each purchase order includes:
- **id**: Unique purchase order identifier
- **invoice**: Invoice number
- **supplier_id**: Associated supplier ID
- **user_id**: User who created the order
- **order_date**: Date order was placed
- **due_date**: Payment due date
- **payment_type**: Payment method (Cash, Credit Card, Bank Transfer, etc.)
- **discount_total**: Discount amount
- **discount_total_type**: Discount type (fixed or percentage)
- **total**: Total order amount
- **status**: Order status (Pending, Approved, Received, Paid, Cancelled)
- **created_at**: Timestamp of creation
- **updated_at**: Timestamp of last update

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase orders retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view purchase orders
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Invalid query parameters
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- View all pending purchase orders awaiting approval
- Monitor orders by supplier for vendor management
- Track payment due dates for accounts payable
- Generate procurement reports and analytics
- Review order history and purchasing patterns
- Filter orders by date range for financial reporting

## Notes
- Results are paginated to optimize performance with large datasets
- Default sorting is by creation date (newest first)
- Use filters to narrow results for specific suppliers or date ranges
- Purchase order totals include applied discounts
- Status field indicates current stage in procurement workflow
- Consider caching results for frequently accessed data
- Permissions may limit visibility to certain orders based on user role

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Creates a new purchase order in the system. This endpoint initiates the procurement process by recording supplier orders, establishing payment terms, and tracking inventory purchases. Use this to formalize purchasing agreements and maintain procurement records.

## HTTP Method & URL
**POST** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/purchases`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
JSON object with the following fields:
- **invoice** (string, required): Unique invoice number or reference (e.g., "INV-2023-001")
- **supplier_id** (integer, required): ID of the supplier providing the goods/services
- **user_id** (integer, required): ID of the user creating the purchase order
- **order_date** (date, required): Date the order is placed (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- **due_date** (date, required): Payment due date (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- **payment_type** (string, required): Payment method (Cash, Credit Card, Bank Transfer, Check, Net 30, Net 60, etc.)
- **discount_total** (decimal, optional): Discount amount or percentage value (e.g., "5.00")
- **discount_total_type** (string, optional): Type of discount - "fixed" for amount or "percentage" for percent
- **total** (decimal, required): Total order amount before discount (e.g., "1500.00")
- **status** (string, optional): Initial order status (default: "Pending") - Options: Pending, Approved, Received, Paid, Cancelled
- **items** (array, optional): Array of line items with product_id, quantity, unit_price

Example:
```json
{
  "invoice": "INV-2023-001",
  "supplier_id": 1,
  "user_id": 1,
  "order_date": "2023-10-26",
  "due_date": "2023-11-26",
  "payment_type": "Cash",
  "discount_total": "5.00",
  "discount_total_type": "fixed",
  "total": "1500.00",
  "status": "Pending"
}
```

## Response Format
Returns the newly created purchase order object with:
- **id**: Unique identifier assigned to the new purchase order
- All submitted fields
- **created_at**: Timestamp of creation
- **updated_at**: Timestamp of creation

## Status Codes
- **201 Created** - Purchase order created successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request format or missing required fields
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to create purchase orders
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (invalid supplier_id, invalid dates, duplicate invoice number, etc.)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Create new supplier orders for inventory replenishment
- Record purchase agreements with vendors
- Initiate procurement workflow for approval
- Generate purchase orders from requisitions
- Establish payment terms and due dates
- Track supplier commitments and delivery schedules
- Create orders with negotiated discounts

## Notes
- Invoice numbers must be unique across the system
- Supplier must exist in the system before creating purchase order
- Order date cannot be in the future (typically)
- Due date should be after order date
- Discount type determines how discount_total is calculated (fixed amount vs percentage of total)
- Status defaults to "Pending" and typically requires approval workflow
- Payment type affects accounts payable processing and cash flow planning
- Consider creating line items separately or include in the same request
- Total amount should match sum of line items before discount
- Some organizations require approval before order is sent to supplier
- Maintain audit trail of all purchase order modifications

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves detailed information for a specific purchase order by its unique identifier. This endpoint provides complete order details including line items, supplier information, payment terms, and current status for procurement tracking and order management.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/purchases/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the purchase order to retrieve

## Query Parameters
- **include** (string, optional): Include related data (e.g., "supplier,items,user" for expanded details)

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
Not applicable for GET requests.

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing the complete purchase order details:
- **id**: Unique purchase order identifier
- **invoice**: Invoice number/reference
- **supplier_id**: Associated supplier ID
- **supplier**: Supplier details (if included)
- **user_id**: User who created the order
- **user**: User details (if included)
- **order_date**: Date the order was placed
- **due_date**: Payment due date
- **payment_type**: Payment method (Cash, Credit Card, Bank Transfer, Check, etc.)
- **discount_total**: Discount amount applied
- **discount_total_type**: Type of discount (fixed amount or percentage)
- **total**: Total order amount after discounts
- **status**: Current order status (Pending, Approved, Received, Paid, Cancelled)
- **items**: Array of line items with product details, quantities, and prices (if included)
- **created_at**: Timestamp when order was created
- **updated_at**: Timestamp of last modification

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view this purchase order
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order with specified ID does not exist
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- View complete details of a specific purchase order
- Review order before approval or receiving
- Verify supplier and payment information
- Check order status and fulfillment progress
- Audit order history and modifications
- Prepare for goods receipt or invoice matching
- Export order details for accounting systems

## Notes
- Use the `include` parameter to fetch related supplier and line item data in a single request
- Purchase order details are read-only through this endpoint
- Status field indicates where the order is in the procurement workflow
- Discount calculations are automatically applied to the total
- Payment type determines accounts payable processing
- Order date and due date are critical for cash flow management
- Permissions may restrict access to orders from specific departments or cost centers

- **include** (string, optional): Include related data (e.g., "supplier,items,user" for expanded details)

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
Not applicable for GET requests.

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing the complete purchase order details:
- **id**: Unique purchase order identifier
- **invoice**: Invoice number/reference
- **supplier_id**: Associated supplier ID
- **supplier**: Supplier details (if included)
- **user_id**: User who created the order
- **user**: User details (if included)
- **order_date**: Date the order was placed
- **due_date**: Payment due date
- **payment_type**: Payment method (Cash, Credit Card, Bank Transfer, Check, etc.)
- **discount_total**: Discount amount applied
- **discount_total_type**: Type of discount (fixed amount or percentage)
- **total**: Total order amount after discounts
- **status**: Current order status (Pending, Approved, Received, Paid, Cancelled)
- **items**: Array of line items with product details, quantities, and prices (if included)
- **created_at**: Timestamp when order was created
- **updated_at**: Timestamp of last modification

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view this purchase order
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order with specified ID does not exist
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- View complete details of a specific purchase order
- Review order before approval or receiving
- Verify supplier and payment information
- Check order status and fulfillment progress
- Audit order history and modifications
- Prepare for goods receipt or invoice matching
- Export order details for accounting systems

## Notes
- Use the `include` parameter to fetch related supplier and line item data in a single request
- Purchase order details are read-only through this endpoint
- Status field indicates where the order is in the procurement workflow
- Discount calculations are automatically applied to the total
- Payment type determines accounts payable processing
- Order date and due date are critical for cash flow management
- Permissions may restrict access to orders from specific departments or cost centers

variable.description: The ID of the purchase.
The ID of the purchase order.

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Updates an existing purchase order with modified information. This endpoint allows you to revise order details, change payment terms, update status, adjust discounts, or correct errors in purchase orders. Essential for managing procurement workflows and maintaining accurate supplier order records.

## HTTP Method & URL
**PUT** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/purchases/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the purchase order to update

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
JSON object with fields to update (all fields are optional, only include fields you want to change):
- **invoice** (string): Invoice number or reference
- **supplier_id** (integer): ID of the supplier
- **user_id** (integer): ID of the user responsible for the order
- **order_date** (date): Date the order was placed (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- **due_date** (date): Payment due date (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- **payment_type** (string): Payment method (Cash, Credit Card, Bank Transfer, Check, Net 30, Net 60, etc.)
- **discount_total** (decimal): Discount amount or percentage value
- **discount_total_type** (string): Type of discount - "fixed" for amount or "percentage" for percent
- **total** (decimal): Total order amount
- **status** (string): Order status - Options: Pending, Approved, Received, Paid, Cancelled

Example:
```json
{
  "invoice": "INV-2023-002",
  "supplier_id": 2,
  "user_id": 1,
  "order_date": "2023-10-27",
  "due_date": "2023-11-27",
  "payment_type": "Credit Card",
  "discount_total": "10.00",
  "discount_total_type": "percentage",
  "total": "2000.00",
  "status": "Paid"
}
```

## Response Format
Returns the updated purchase order object with:
- **id**: Purchase order identifier
- All current field values (including updated ones)
- **updated_at**: Timestamp of the update

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Purchase order updated successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request format
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to update purchase orders
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order with specified ID does not exist
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (invalid supplier_id, invalid dates, duplicate invoice, status transition not allowed, etc.)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Update order status as it progresses through approval workflow (Pending  Approved  Received  Paid)
- Modify payment terms or due dates based on supplier negotiations
- Correct data entry errors in order details
- Change supplier if order is reassigned
- Apply additional discounts or adjust pricing
- Update invoice numbers when finalized
- Cancel orders by changing status to "Cancelled"
- Adjust totals when line items are modified

## Notes
- **IMPORTANT**: Some fields may be locked once order reaches certain statuses (e.g., cannot change supplier after order is Received)
- Status transitions may follow specific workflow rules (e.g., Pending  Approved  Received  Paid)
- Changing status to "Received" may trigger inventory updates
- Changing status to "Paid" may affect accounts payable records
- Invoice numbers must remain unique across the system
- Due date should be after order date
- Discount type determines calculation method (fixed amount vs percentage)
- Some organizations require re-approval if order total changes significantly
- Audit trail should track all modifications for compliance
- Cannot update orders that are already paid (status: Paid) in some systems
- Consider notifying supplier of significant changes
- Line items may need separate update endpoints

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Permanently removes a purchase order from the system. This endpoint deletes the specified purchase order and handles cleanup of associated line items and records. Use with caution as this operation cannot be undone.

## HTTP Method & URL
**DELETE** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/purchases/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the purchase order to delete

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
Not applicable for DELETE requests.

## Response Format
Returns a success message or empty response with appropriate status code.

## Status Codes
- **204 No Content** - Purchase order deleted successfully
- **200 OK** - Purchase order deleted with confirmation message
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to delete purchase orders
- **404 Not Found** - Purchase order with specified ID does not exist
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Cannot delete purchase order (already received, has payments, or is approved)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Remove cancelled purchase orders
- Delete duplicate order entries
- Clean up test orders from production
- Remove orders created in error
- Cancel and remove pending orders

## Notes
- **IMPORTANT**: This operation is permanent and cannot be undone
- Received or partially received orders typically cannot be deleted
- Orders with associated payments may be protected from deletion
- Approved orders may require unapproval before deletion
- Consider cancelling orders instead of deleting to preserve audit trail
- Deletion affects procurement reporting and financial records
- Ensure proper backup procedures before deletion
- Alternative: Update order status to 'Cancelled' rather than deleting

item.description:
## Overview
The Purchase Orders resource manages the complete procurement process in Invent-MAG, from requisition through to receiving goods from suppliers. Purchase orders formalize purchasing agreements and track the entire procurement lifecycle.

## Purpose
Purchase Orders document formal requests to suppliers for products or services, establishing terms, pricing, and delivery expectations. They provide procurement control, enable inventory planning, and create an audit trail for all purchasing activities.

## Key Functionality
- Create and manage supplier purchase orders
- Track order status from draft to completed
- Support approval workflows
- Manage multiple delivery schedules
- Handle partial receipts and backorders
- Calculate order totals with taxes and discounts
- Generate purchase order documents
- Track order amendments and revisions
- Support drop-shipping scenarios
- Enable purchase order templates

## Common Operations
- **GET /purchase-orders** - List all purchase orders with filtering by supplier, status, date
- **GET /purchase-orders/{id}** - Retrieve complete purchase order with all items
- **POST /purchase-orders** - Create new purchase orders
- **PUT/PATCH /purchase-orders/{id}** - Update order details, status, or terms
- **DELETE /purchase-orders/{id}** - Cancel or remove purchase orders

## Relationships
- **Suppliers**: Orders are placed with specific suppliers
- **Purchase Order Items**: Line items detail products being ordered
- **Products**: Products being procured
- **Warehouses**: Destination for received goods
- **Payments**: Supplier payments against purchase orders
- **Stock Adjustments**: Receiving creates inventory adjustments
- **Accounts**: Orders affect inventory and accounts payable
- **Journal Entries**: Financial entries for received goods
- **Users**: Order created by and approved by users
- **Currency Settings**: Multi-currency purchase support

## Important Fields
- Purchase order number
- Order date and expected delivery date
- Supplier information
- Order status (draft, pending, approved, partial, received, cancelled)
- Shipping address and terms
- Payment terms
- Subtotal, tax, shipping, and total amount
- Currency and exchange rate
- Notes and special instructions
- Approval status and approver
- Receiving status
- Invoice matching status

## Business Context
Use these endpoints when:
- Ordering inventory from suppliers
- Managing procurement workflows
- Receiving goods into warehouses
- Tracking outstanding orders and deliveries
- Reconciling supplier invoices
- Analyzing purchasing patterns and costs
- Managing supplier relationships
- Planning inventory replenishment
- Supporting approval processes
- Generating purchase reports
- Integrating with supplier systems
- Managing drop-ship orders
- Tracking procurement budgets and spending

item.name: Roles

query.description: The number of roles to return per page. Defaults to 15.

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves a paginated list of all roles in the system. This endpoint provides access to role definitions including their names, descriptions, associated permissions, and metadata. Useful for displaying role lists in admin interfaces, permission management screens, and user assignment workflows.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/roles`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
- **per_page** (integer, optional): Number of roles to return per page (default: 25, max: 100)
- **page** (integer, optional): Page number for pagination (default: 1)
- **sort** (string, optional): Sort field (options: `name`, `created_at`, `updated_at`)
- **order** (string, optional): Sort order (`asc` or `desc`, default: `asc`)
- **search** (string, optional): Search term to filter roles by name or description
- **type** (string, optional): Filter by role type (`system` or `custom`)

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
None - This is a GET request

## Response Format
Returns a paginated JSON object containing an array of role objects with metadata:
```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Admin",
      "description": "Full system access",
      "type": "system",
      "permissions": ["view_all", "create_all", "edit_all", "delete_all"],
      "user_count": 5,
      "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
      "updated_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "meta": {
    "current_page": 1,
    "per_page": 25,
    "total": 50,
    "last_page": 2
  }
}
```

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Roles retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view roles
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Invalid query parameters
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Display all available roles in admin dashboard
- Populate role selection dropdowns for user assignment
- Audit role configurations across the system
- Filter and search for specific roles
- Export role lists for documentation
- Monitor role usage and user assignments

## Notes
- System roles (Admin, Manager, User) cannot be deleted but can be viewed
- Custom roles are created by administrators for specific organizational needs
- The `user_count` field shows how many users are assigned to each role
- Pagination is recommended for systems with many roles
- Use the `search` parameter for quick role lookups
- Role permissions are returned as an array of permission strings
- Requires `view_roles` permission to access this endpoint

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Creates a new custom role in the system with specified permissions. This endpoint allows administrators to define new roles for role-based access control (RBAC), assign permissions, and establish access levels for user groups. Essential for implementing granular security policies and organizational hierarchies.

## HTTP Method & URL
**POST** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/roles`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
JSON object containing the new role details:
```json
{
  "name": "Admin",
  "description": "Administrator role with full system access",
  "permissions": [
    "view_products",
    "create_products",
    "edit_products",
    "delete_products",
    "view_customers",
    "create_customers",
    "manage_users",
    "view_reports"
  ],
  "type": "custom"
}
```

**Required Fields:**
- **name** (string): Unique role name (3-50 characters)

**Optional Fields:**
- **description** (string): Role description explaining its purpose
- **permissions** (array): Array of permission strings to assign to the role
- **type** (string): Role type (`custom` by default, `system` is reserved)

## Response Format
Returns the newly created role object with assigned ID and timestamps:
```json
{
  "id": 15,
  "name": "Admin",
  "description": "Administrator role with full system access",
  "type": "custom",
  "permissions": [
    "view_products",
    "create_products",
    "edit_products",
    "delete_products",
    "view_customers",
    "create_customers",
    "manage_users",
    "view_reports"
  ],
  "user_count": 0,
  "created_at": "2024-01-20T14:25:00Z",
  "updated_at": "2024-01-20T14:25:00Z"
}
```

## Status Codes
- **201 Created** - Role created successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request data format
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to create roles
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (duplicate name, invalid permissions)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Create department-specific roles (Sales Manager, Marketing Lead)
- Define project-based access roles
- Establish hierarchical permission structures
- Set up temporary roles for contractors or seasonal staff
- Create audit or read-only roles for compliance
- Design custom workflows with specific permission sets

## Notes
- Role names must be unique across the system
- System roles (Admin, Manager, User) are pre-defined and cannot be duplicated
- Permissions must exist in the system's permission registry
- Invalid permissions in the array will cause validation errors
- New roles start with zero users assigned
- Requires `create_roles` permission to access this endpoint
- Consider permission inheritance and conflicts when designing roles
- Role names are case-sensitive
- Maximum of 100 permissions can be assigned to a single role

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves detailed information about a specific role by its unique identifier. This endpoint provides complete role details including name, description, permissions, assigned user count, and metadata. Useful for viewing role configurations, auditing permissions, and displaying role details in admin interfaces.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/roles/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the role to retrieve

## Query Parameters
- **include** (string, optional): Additional data to include (options: `users`, `permissions_details`, `audit_log`)
- **users_limit** (integer, optional): Limit number of users returned when including users (default: 10)

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
None - This is a GET request

## Response Format
Returns a detailed role object with all associated information:
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Admin",
  "description": "Full system administrator with unrestricted access",
  "type": "system",
  "permissions": [
    "view_all",
    "create_all",
    "edit_all",
    "delete_all",
    "manage_users",
    "manage_roles",
    "view_reports",
    "system_settings"
  ],
  "user_count": 5,
  "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
  "updated_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
  "created_by": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "System"
  }
}
```

With `include=users`:
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Admin",
  "description": "Full system administrator with unrestricted access",
  "type": "system",
  "permissions": ["view_all", "create_all", "edit_all", "delete_all"],
  "user_count": 5,
  "users": [
    {
      "id": 10,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "assigned_at": "2024-01-16T09:00:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
  "updated_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
}
```

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Role retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view role details
- **404 Not Found** - Role with specified ID does not exist
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Invalid query parameters
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Display role details in admin dashboard
- View complete permission sets for a role
- Audit role configurations and assignments
- Show role information before editing
- Verify role permissions for compliance
- Display role details to users during assignment
- Export role configurations for documentation
- Compare roles for permission analysis

## Notes
- System roles (Admin, Manager, User) have `type: "system"`
- Custom roles created by administrators have `type: "custom"`
- The `user_count` field shows total users assigned to this role
- Use `include=users` to see which users have this role
- Use `include=permissions_details` for expanded permission information
- Use `include=audit_log` to see role modification history
- Requires `view_roles` permission to access this endpoint
- Permission arrays show all capabilities granted by the role
- Role details are cached for performance (cache TTL: 5 minutes)
- System roles cannot be modified or deleted

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Updates an existing role in the system. This endpoint allows modification of role details including name, description, and associated permissions. Essential for maintaining role-based access control (RBAC) as organizational needs evolve, adjusting permission sets, and refining security policies.

## HTTP Method & URL
**PUT** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/roles/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the role to update

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
JSON object containing fields to update (only include fields you want to change):
```json
{
  "name": "Editor",
  "description": "Content editor with publishing rights",
  "permissions": [
    "view_products",
    "create_products",
    "edit_products",
    "view_customers",
    "create_sales",
    "publish_content"
  ]
}
```

**Updatable Fields:**
- **name** (string): Role name (must be unique, 3-50 characters)
- **description** (string): Role description
- **permissions** (array): Array of permission strings (replaces existing permissions)

## Response Format
Returns the updated role object with modified fields, associated permissions, and updated timestamp:
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Editor",
  "description": "Content editor with publishing rights",
  "type": "custom",
  "permissions": [
    "view_products",
    "create_products",
    "edit_products",
    "view_customers",
    "create_sales",
    "publish_content"
  ],
  "user_count": 8,
  "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
  "updated_at": "2024-01-20T16:45:00Z"
}
```

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Role updated successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request data format
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to update roles
- **404 Not Found** - Role with specified ID does not exist
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (duplicate name, invalid permissions)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Update role names or descriptions for clarity
- Modify role permissions as business requirements change
- Add or remove permissions from roles
- Adjust access levels for user groups
- Refine role-based access control policies
- Update role configurations after security audits
- Expand or restrict role capabilities

## Notes
- Only include fields you want to update in the request body
- Role names must remain unique across the system
- System roles (Admin, Manager, User) have restrictions on modifications
- Permission changes affect all users with this role immediately
- The `permissions` array replaces all existing permissions (not additive)
- Invalid permissions will cause validation errors
- Requires `edit_roles` permission to access this endpoint
- Consider the impact on assigned users before making changes
- Audit logs track all role modifications
- Cannot change role `type` from `system` to `custom` or vice versa
- Maximum of 100 permissions can be assigned to a single role

variable.description: The ID of the role.
The ID of the role.

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Permanently deletes a role from the system. This endpoint removes custom roles that are no longer needed, helping maintain a clean role structure. System roles cannot be deleted. Users assigned to the deleted role will need to be reassigned to other roles before or after deletion.

## HTTP Method & URL
**DELETE** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/roles/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the role to delete

## Query Parameters
- **force** (boolean, optional): Force deletion even if users are assigned (default: false)
- **reassign_to** (integer, optional): Role ID to reassign users to before deletion

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
None - This is a DELETE request

## Response Format
Returns a success message confirming the deletion:
```json
{
  "message": "Role deleted successfully",
  "deleted_role_id": 1,
  "deleted_role_name": "Custom Editor",
  "affected_users": 0,
  "deleted_at": "2024-01-20T17:30:00Z"
}
```

If users were reassigned:
```json
{
  "message": "Role deleted successfully",
  "deleted_role_id": 1,
  "deleted_role_name": "Custom Editor",
  "affected_users": 5,
  "reassigned_to_role_id": 3,
  "reassigned_to_role_name": "User",
  "deleted_at": "2024-01-20T17:30:00Z"
}
```

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Role deleted successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Cannot delete role with assigned users (without force flag)
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to delete roles or attempting to delete system role
- **404 Not Found** - Role with specified ID does not exist
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (invalid reassign_to role ID)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Remove obsolete or unused custom roles
- Clean up roles after organizational restructuring
- Delete temporary project-based roles after completion
- Remove duplicate or incorrectly configured roles
- Maintain a streamlined role structure
- Decommission roles during system migrations

## Notes
- System roles (Admin, Manager, User) cannot be deleted
- Only custom roles can be removed from the system
- By default, deletion fails if users are assigned to the role
- Use `force=true` to delete roles with assigned users (users will lose role access)
- Use `reassign_to` parameter to automatically reassign users before deletion
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
- Requires `delete_roles` permission to access this endpoint
- Audit logs record all role deletions with timestamps and user details
- Consider reassigning users before deletion to prevent access disruptions
- Role permissions are immediately revoked for all assigned users
- Deleted role IDs are not reused
- Recommended to export role configuration before deletion for backup

variable.description: The ID of the role.
The ID of the role to delete.

item.description:
## Overview
The Roles resource manages role-based access control (RBAC) in the Invent-MAG system. Roles define sets of permissions that control what users can view, create, modify, or delete within the application, ensuring security and proper authorization.

## Purpose
Roles establish security boundaries and access levels for different user types in the organization. By grouping permissions into roles, administrators can efficiently manage user access rights, maintain data security, and ensure compliance with business policies.

## Key Functionality
- Define custom roles with specific permissions
- Assign granular permissions for each module
- Support hierarchical role structures
- Enable role-based feature access
- Manage CRUD permissions per resource
- Support role inheritance
- Configure dashboard and report access
- Enable role-based workflow approvals
- Track role assignments and changes

## Common Operations
- **GET /roles** - List all roles with their permissions
- **GET /roles/{id}** - Retrieve specific role details and assigned users
- **POST /roles** - Create new roles with permission sets
- **PUT/PATCH /roles/{id}** - Update role permissions or properties
- **DELETE /roles/{id}** - Remove roles (requires reassigning users)

## Relationships
- **Users**: Users are assigned one or more roles
- **Permissions**: Roles contain collections of permissions
- All Resources: Roles control access to all system resources including:
  - Products, Categories, Warehouses
  - Customers, Suppliers, Interactions
  - Sales Orders, Purchase Orders
  - Payments, Transactions, Accounts
  - Reports and Analytics

## Important Fields
- Role name and description
- Permission set (create, read, update, delete per module)
- Role level or hierarchy
- Active/inactive status
- System role flag (for built-in roles)
- Assigned user count
- Module access permissions
- Report and dashboard access
- Approval authority levels
- Data visibility scope (own, team, all)

## Business Context
Use these endpoints when:
- Setting up initial user access control
- Creating department-specific roles (Sales, Warehouse, Finance)
- Defining job function roles (Manager, Clerk, Administrator)
- Implementing least-privilege security principles
- Managing user onboarding and offboarding
- Auditing access permissions
- Complying with security policies
- Segregating duties for financial controls
- Configuring approval workflows
- Supporting multi-tenant scenarios
- Restricting sensitive data access
- Customizing user experiences by role

## Common Role Examples
- **Administrator**: Full system access
- **Sales Manager**: Customer, orders, opportunities management
- **Warehouse Manager**: Inventory, stock adjustments, receiving
- **Accountant**: Financial records, reports, reconciliation
- **Sales Representative**: Customer interactions, quotes, limited order access
- **Warehouse Clerk**: Stock movements, basic inventory operations

item.name: Sales Items

query.description: The number of items to return per page. Defaults to 15.

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves a paginated list of all sales items (line items) across all sales orders. This endpoint returns detailed information about individual products within sales orders, including quantities, pricing, discounts, and totals.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/sales-items?per_page=25`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
- **per_page** (integer, optional): Number of sales items to return per page (default: 25, max: 100)
- **page** (integer, optional): Page number for pagination (default: 1)
- **sales_id** (integer, optional): Filter sales items by specific sales order ID
- **product_id** (integer, optional): Filter sales items by specific product ID
- **sort_by** (string, optional): Field to sort by (e.g., created_at, total, quantity)
- **sort_order** (string, optional): Sort direction (asc or desc)

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
Not applicable for GET requests.

## Response Format
Returns a paginated JSON array of sales item objects. Each sales item includes:
- **id**: Unique identifier for the sales item
- **sales_id**: Parent sales order ID
- **product_id**: Associated product ID
- **product_name**: Name of the product
- **quantity**: Number of units ordered
- **customer_price**: Unit price charged to customer
- **discount**: Discount amount or percentage
- **discount_type**: Type of discount (fixed or percentage)
- **total**: Line item total (quantity  price - discount)
- **created_at**: Timestamp of creation
- **updated_at**: Timestamp of last update

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Sales items retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view sales items
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Invalid query parameters
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- View all line items across orders for inventory analysis
- Generate sales reports by product
- Track order composition and product performance
- Monitor discount usage across orders
- Analyze pricing and revenue by line item
- Export order details for accounting purposes

## Notes
- Results are paginated to optimize performance with large datasets
- Use filtering parameters to narrow results by order or product
- Line item totals reflect applied discounts
- Deleted sales items are not included in results
- Total amount includes customer-specific pricing adjustments
- Use sales_id filter to get all items for a specific order
- Inventory levels are not included (use products endpoint for stock data)

query.description: The number of items to return per page. Defaults to 15.

request.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Creates a new sales item (line item) and adds it to an existing sales order. This endpoint allows adding products to orders with specified quantities, pricing, and discount information. The parent order's total is automatically recalculated.

## HTTP Method & URL
**POST** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/sales-items`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
JSON object with the following fields:
- **sales_id** (integer, required): ID of the parent sales order
- **product_id** (integer, required): ID of the product to add
- **quantity** (integer, required): Number of units (must be positive)
- **customer_price** (decimal, required): Unit price for the customer
- **discount** (decimal, optional): Discount amount or percentage (default: 0.00)
- **discount_type** (string, optional): Type of discount - "fixed" or "percentage" (default: fixed)
- **total** (decimal, required): Line item total (quantity  price - discount)

**Example:**
```json
{
  "sales_id": 1,
  "product_id": 1,
  "quantity": 5,
  "discount": "0.00",
  "discount_type": "fixed",
  "customer_price": "100.00",
  "total": "500.00"
}
```

## Response Format
Returns the newly created sales item object with all fields including the generated ID, timestamps, and calculated totals. Parent order totals are updated automatically.

## Status Codes
- **201 Created** - Sales item created successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request format or missing required fields
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to create sales items
- **404 Not Found** - Sales order or product not found
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (invalid quantity, price, insufficient inventory, etc.)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Add products to new or existing orders
- Create order line items during order entry
- Add additional items to pending orders
- Build orders programmatically from shopping carts
- Import order details from external systems
- Add custom-priced items to orders

## Notes
- The sales order must exist before adding items
- Product must be active and available in inventory
- Quantity must not exceed available stock (if inventory tracking is enabled)
- Total should equal (quantity  customer_price) - discount
- For percentage discounts, discount value should be between 0-100
- Parent order status must allow modifications (not completed/shipped)
- Inventory levels are automatically adjusted when item is created
- Customer-specific pricing can override standard product prices
- Discount calculations are validated server-side

originalRequest.description:
## Endpoint Overview
Creates a new sales item (line item) and adds it to an existing sales order. This endpoint allows adding products to orders with specified quantities, pricing, and discount information. The parent order's total is automatically recalculated.

## HTTP Method & URL
**POST** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/sales-items`

## Path Parameters
None

## Query Parameters
None

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
JSON object with the following fields:
- **sales_id** (integer, required): ID of the parent sales order
- **product_id** (integer, required): ID of the product to add
- **quantity** (integer, required): Number of units (must be positive)
- **customer_price** (decimal, required): Unit price for the customer
- **discount** (decimal, optional): Discount amount or percentage (default: 0.00)
- **discount_type** (string, optional): Type of discount - "fixed" or "percentage" (default: fixed)
- **total** (decimal, required): Line item total (quantity  price - discount)

**Example:**
```json
{
  "sales_id": 1,
  "product_id": 1,
  "quantity": 5,
  "discount": "0.00",
  "discount_type": "fixed",
  "customer_price": "100.00",
  "total": "500.00"
}
```

## Response Format
Returns the newly created sales item object with all fields including the generated ID, timestamps, and calculated totals. Parent order totals are updated automatically.

## Status Codes
- **201 Created** - Sales item created successfully
- **400 Bad Request** - Invalid request format or missing required fields
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to create sales items
- **404 Not Found** - Sales order or product not found
- **422 Unprocessable Entity** - Validation errors (invalid quantity, price, insufficient inventory, etc.)
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- Add products to new or existing orders
- Create order line items during order entry
- Add additional items to pending orders
- Build orders programmatically from shopping carts
- Import order details from external systems
- Add custom-priced items to orders

## Notes
- The sales order must exist before adding items
- Product must be active and available in inventory
- Quantity must not exceed available stock (if inventory tracking is enabled)
- Total should equal (quantity  customer_price) - discount
- For percentage discounts, discount value should be between 0-100
- Parent order status must allow modifications (not completed/shipped)
- Inventory levels are automatically adjusted when item is created
- Customer-specific pricing can override standard product prices
- Discount calculations are validated server-side

## Endpoint Overview
Retrieves detailed information about a specific sales item (line item) by its unique identifier. This endpoint returns complete details including product information, pricing, discounts, and associated order data.

## HTTP Method & URL
**GET** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v1/sales-items/:id`

## Path Parameters
- **id** (integer, required): The unique identifier of the sales item to retrieve

## Query Parameters
- **include** (string, optional): Related data to include (e.g., product, sales_order, customer)

## Request Headers
- **Content-Type**: `application/json` - Specifies JSON request format
- **Accept**: `application/json` - Expects JSON response
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{access_token}}` - Required authentication token

## Request Body
Not applicable for GET requests.

## Response Format
Returns a JSON object containing the sales item details:
- **id**: Unique identifier for the sales item
- **sales_id**: Parent sales order ID
- **product_id**: Associated product ID
- **product_name**: Name of the product
- **product_sku**: Product SKU/code
- **quantity**: Number of units ordered
- **customer_price**: Unit price charged to customer
- **discount**: Discount amount or percentage applied
- **discount_type**: Type of discount (fixed or percentage)
- **total**: Line item total after discount
- **created_at**: Timestamp when item was added
- **updated_at**: Timestamp of last modification
- **created_by**: User who created the item
- **updated_by**: User who last modified the item

## Status Codes
- **200 OK** - Sales item retrieved successfully
- **401 Unauthorized** - Missing or invalid authentication token
- **403 Forbidden** - Insufficient permissions to view this sales item
- **404 Not Found** - Sales item with specified ID does not exist
- **500 Internal Server Error** - Server-side error occurred

## Usage Examples
- View details of a specific line item in an order
- Verify pricing and discount calculations
- Audit order item changes and history
- Display line item details in order management interfaces
- Retrieve item information for customer service inquiries
- Validate order composition before processing

## Notes
- Only returns active (non-deleted) sales items
- Use the include parameter to fetch related product or order details
- Pricing reflects customer-specific rates if applicable
- Discount calculations are shown in detail
- Timestamps track creation and modification history
- Item totals may differ from product list prices due to discounts
- Related order status affects whether item can be modified
